channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israeli Strikes in Gaza Kill at Least 100, Local Health Officials Say
item.description: After what appeared to be the deadliest day since a truce deal was agreed on this month, Israel said the cease-fire had resumed.

item.title: Teens who use weed before age 15 have more trouble later, a study finds
item.description: Young teens who use cannabis are more likely to be frequent users than people who start later, according to a study in JAMA Network Open. They are als...

item.title: Obamacare Prices Become Public, Highlighting Big Increases
item.description: The government website now shows consumers how much their health insurance costs will increase next year, as Congress remains at an impasse over the p...

item.title: Hurricane Melissa leaves Jamaica devastated. And, the shutdown's impact on airports
item.description: Officials are assessing the damage after Hurricane Melissa made landfall in Jamaica as a Category 5. And, how the government shutdown is impacting air...

item.title: White House fires entire commission that reviews designs for federal buildings
item.description: The White House has fired all six members of the U.S. Commission of Fine Arts, the independent federal agency that reviews design plans for monuments,...

item.title: Greetings from high up in Colombia's Andes, where 'prairie-style meat' is a delicacy
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: How the Opium War Still Shapes Xi Jinping’s Trade Clash With Trump
item.description: China’s leader draws on lessons from Lin Zexu, a Qing official whose defiance of Britain led to China’s humiliating defeat but made him a national her...

item.title: Israel says it's resuming the ceasefire after its strikes in Gaza kill over 100 people
item.description: Israel's military said the ceasefire in Gaza resumed after it carried out heavy airstrikes overnight that killed 104 people, including 46 children, ac...

item.title: Whole Foods, MAHA and the Battle Over Healthy Eating in America
item.description: As diet and wellness become increasingly politicized, one of the most recognizable grocery brands navigates the debate.

item.title: Money to Help Nations Cope With Climate Disasters Is Declining, U.N. Says
item.description: In 2021, rich countries vowed to spend more to help poor countries adapt to warming. That goal is unlikely to be met, a new report finds.

item.title: As China and U.S. Fight Over Energy, Korea Is Stuck in the Middle

item.title: Money to Help Nations Cope With Climate Disasters Is Declining, U.N. Says
item.description: In 2021, rich countries vowed to spend more to help poor countries adapt to warming. That goal is unlikely to be met, a new report finds.

item.title: Mercedes Reports a Drop in Profit but Maintains Its Forecast
item.description: The German carmaker held its outlook steady and said it would buy back more than $2 billion in shares, as sales of its high-end models improved.

item.title: Live Updates: Hurricane Melissa Batters Cuba as Jamaica Assesses Damage

item.title: Feted as a Peacemaker in South Korea, Trump Finds Purpose for Overtures to Kim Jong-un
